moves.1. e4: Just won 9 in a row.  I’ve been pretty “streaky” lately.  Opponent from Portugal.  His games don't include many normal Sicilians.
Game note: “5...e6 my 7 vs his 4 in centre.  I’m pretty happy with my development.”
moves.6. Bb5: Game note: “6.Bb5 seems typical but his B will need to retreat right back to whence it came.  I think d4 would have been good.”
moves.6... Bd7 7. O-O a6 8. Ba4: Game note: “8.Ba4? nope.  Needed to exchange to maintain initiative or retreat to keep the LSB.”
moves.13... Be7: Game note: “13...Be7 not a critical move but how to decide over ...Be6.  The latter controls a central square but reduces it's scope.  The text move maintains or "improves" scope and allows for ...O-O.  I’m +2 material.  I control 5 in the centre vs his 6.”
Is it worth the isolated pawn to maintain initiative and eliminate another one of his pawns controlling a central square?  I thought so.
moves.15. Qxd3 O-O 16. Nh2: Or develop his DSB to connect his rooks.
moves.16... Qc8: Leaves my isolani a bit weak but creates an immediate threat on his K-side.
moves.17... Ne4 18. Rxe4: Game note: “18.Rxe4?! really!!  Here come the fireworks.”  Checking now afterward and I think it’s unsound.  But as the game plays out he’s able to use it to his advantage.
moves.18... dxe4 19. Bh6 Bf6 20. Nc4: Game note: “20.Nc4 sets up a Q/R fork on b6.  Can I still get in ...Bf5.”
moves.20... Bf5: In hindsight, how did I not realize there was no time for …Bf5.  I missed 20…Nd4 …Ne2+ solving all my problems.  If 21.cxd4 then I have the discovered capture 21…Qxc4 and his pawn to boot.
moves.21. Ne3: I don’t get it.  Did he not see Nb6 or Nd6.
moves.21... Bg6: And my K is safe.  …Be5 also looks decisive.
moves.22. Bf4 Qe6: Game note: “22...Qe6 and ...Rd8 would also be nice.”
moves.23. a3: Planning to advance his c-pawn maybe??
moves.23... Rfd8 24. Nhg4 Rd2: Game note: “24...Rd2 is a powerful post but dangerous on account of discovered attack from his DSB.”
moves.25. Nxf6+ Qxf6 26. Ng4: Game note: “26.Ng4 and there is the discovered attack. Nice move! (worried).  Guess I should have recaptured with the ugly 25…gxf6.”
moves.28... Qb2: Game note: “28...Qb2 check that one out.”  Yes in hindsight …h5 or …f5 to push the N and threaten his Q.
moves.29. Rf1 Qxa3: Game note: “29...Qxa3 gives me some relief on the Q-side.  Also hoping to get in ...h5 of ...f5 for K escape.”
moves.30. Qc7: Game note: “30.Qc7! wide open game.  I need initiative again. (worried)”
moves.30... Nd8 31. f4: Game note: “31.f4 is this a trick?  Sure opens up the f-file for him.  I still have ...Qc8+ in my back pocket if Rxf3”.  Playing through afterward I can’t see any trick or benefit.
moves.33. Kh2 Qd2: Playing around too much with my Q.
moves.34. Re3 h5: Somehow I thought this was a simple choice but I was wrong.
moves.35. Re8+ Kh7 36. Ne5: Game note: “36.Ne5 at first this move scared me but I'm starting to look at some good possibilities involving ...Qf4 pinning the N; ...Ne6 attacking the Q and discovered attack on his R; ...f6 pushing the N and discovered attack on his R.  So maybe I actually have an advantage here (plus material so yes I do).  36...Qf6 maintains the possibility of the others.  Good tactics but at some point I still need to mind the structural imbalance on the Q-side.”
moves.38... Kxh8 39. Nxg6+: Game note: “39.Ng6+ a brutal fork.  What the heck happened?  I thought f7 was overprotected, but I might as well resign.”  In hindsight, I guess the innocent looking 36…Qf4+ …f6 were faulty.  But it looked so good at the time.  Let’s insert 27…Ne6 and force him to move his Q first maybe…?  At least that also reveals a discovered attack on his R.
